pullRequest.title: FIX(SystemTests) Dynamic Log changes unable to check from kafka-pods
pullRequest.bodyText:
Signed-off-by: Michal Tóth mtoth@redhat.com
Tests were unable to connect to exposed Connect|MM2 service  and check for dynamically changed log level.
io.strimzi.systemtest.log.LoggingChangeST#testDynamicallySetConnectLoggingLevels checks this value using curl from kafkaClients pod.
io.strimzi.systemtest.log.LoggingChangeST#testDynamicallySetMM2LoggingLevels MM2 NetworkPolicy allows only connection from MM2 or cluster-operator pod -> thus this check is performed from MM2 pod

nodes.bodyText:
Why is this changed?
And Kafka doesn't have container kafka-clients.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -848,13 +849,13 @@ void testDynamicallySetKafkaExternalLogging() {
 
         TestUtils.waitFor("Verify logger change", Constants.GLOBAL_POLL_INTERVAL, Constants.GLOBAL_TIMEOUT,
             () -> cmdKubeClient().execInPodContainer(KafkaResources.kafkaPodName(CLUSTER_NAME, 0),
-                        "kafka", "/bin/bash", "-c", "bin/kafka-configs.sh --bootstrap-server localhost:9092 --describe --entity-type broker-loggers --entity-name 0").out()
+                        "kafka-clients", "/bin/bash", "-c", "bin/kafka-configs.sh --bootstrap-server localhost:9092 --describe --entity-type broker-loggers --entity-name 0").out()

beforeCommit.message:
FIX(SystemTests) Logging changes are not checked from kafka pod (use kafka clients pod)

Signed-off-by: Michal Tóth <mtoth@redhat.com>
